Rest_API documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Checks the health of the database connection.

This function attempts to execute a simple SQL query (SELECT 1) to verify that the database is properly configured and accessible. If the query fails or returns no results, an HTTP 500 error is raised. If the database is reachable and the query succeeds, a welcome message is returned.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – The database session used for executing the query.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a welcome message if the database is healthy.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the database is not properly configured or there is an error connecting to the database.

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.index()¶

Returns a simple welcome message for the Contact Application.

This function acts as the root endpoint of the application, providing a basic response with a welcome message indicating that the Contact Application is running.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a welcome message.

Return type:

dict

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

Initializes the Redis connection and sets up FastAPI rate limiting.

This function connects to the Redis server using the specified host, port, and password from the configuration. It then initializes the FastAPI rate limiter with the Redis connection to handle request rate limiting.

Raises:

RedisError – If the connection to the Redis server fails.

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository CONTACTS¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Creates a new contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The data for the new contact

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query

  • user (User) – The user who owns the new contact

Returns:

The newly created contact

Return type:

Contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Deletes a specific contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact

Returns:

The deleted contact if found, otherwise None

Return type:

Contact or None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

Retrieves a list of all contacts with pagination.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before starting to collect the results

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query

Returns:

A list of all contacts

Return type:

list[Contact]

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays_upcoming(db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays within the next week for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are being checked for upcoming birthdays

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays fall within the next week

Return type:

list[Contact]

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieves a specific contact by its ID for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query

  • user (User) – The user to whom the contact belongs

Returns:

The contact if found, otherwise None

Return type:

Contact or None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the specified user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before starting to collect the results

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are being retrieved

Returns:

A list of contacts associated with the specified user

Return type:

list[Contact]

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str | None, last_name: str | None, email: str | None, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Searches for contacts based on the specified criteria for the given user.

Parameters:

  • first_name (Optional[str]) – The first name to search for (optional)

  • last_name (Optional[str]) – The last name to search for (optional)

  • email (Optional[str]) – The email to search for (optional)

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are being searched

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

Return type:

list[Contact]

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Updates an existing contact for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – The updated data for the contact

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query

  • user (User) – The user who owns the contact

Returns:

The updated contact if found, otherwise None

Return type:

Contact or None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository USERS¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Marks the user with the specified email as confirmed.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to mark as confirmed

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the update

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Creates a new user with the provided data and generates an avatar from the user’s email.

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – The data for the new user

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query (optional, default is provided by dependency injection)

Returns:

The newly created user

Return type:

User

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves a user by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to retrieve

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the query (optional, default is provided by dependency injection)

Returns:

The user with the specified email if found, otherwise None

Return type:

User or None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Updates the avatar URL for the user with the specified email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose avatar URL is being updated

  • url (str | None) – The new avatar URL, or None to clear the avatar

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the update

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar URL

Return type:

User

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Updates the refresh token for the specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose refresh token is being updated

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token value, or None to clear the token

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute the update

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes AUTH¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms the user’s email based on the provided verification token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The verification token used to confirm the user’s email

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection)

Returns:

A dictionary with a message indicating the result of the email confirmation

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not exist or there is an error in the verification process

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticates a user and generates access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The form data containing username (email) and password

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection)

Returns:

A dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user does not exist, email is not confirmed, or the password is incorrect

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refreshes the access token using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The credentials containing the refresh token

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection)

Returns:

A dictionary containing the new access token, refresh token, and token type

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid or does not match the user’s stored token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Handles the request for tracking email opens by returning an image.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the user who opened the email

  • response (Response) – The HTTP response object used to return the image

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection)

Returns:

A FileResponse containing an image to indicate that the email was opened

Return type:

FileResponse

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Handles user signup by creating a new user if the email does not already exist.

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – The data for the new user including email and password

  • bt (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks manager for scheduling asynchronous tasks

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object, used to get the base URL for email

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection)

Returns:

The newly created user

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If a user with the given email already exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes CONTACTS¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Creates a new contact for the authenticated user based on the provided contact data.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The contact data to create a new contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user for whom the contact is being created (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Deletes a contact for the authenticated user based on the provided contact ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete, must be greater than or equal to 1.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user for whom the contact is being deleted (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

Returns:

The deleted contact if it exists and was successfully removed.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID does not exist or does not belong to the authenticated user.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays_upcoming(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves contacts with upcoming birthdays within the next week for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user for whom to retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays occurring in the upcoming week.

Return type:

list

Raises:

HTTPException – If no contacts with upcoming birthdays are found for the authenticated user.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a specific contact for the authenticated user by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve, must be greater than or equal to 1.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user for whom to retrieve the contact (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID if it exists.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID does not exist or does not belong to the authenticated user.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a paginated list of all contacts for the authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return, must be between 10 and 500 (inclusive).

  • offset (int) – The starting point for the list of contacts, must be 0 or greater.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user for whom to retrieve contacts (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

Returns:

A list of contacts for the authenticated user.

Return type:

list

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Searches for contacts of the authenticated user based on optional filters for first name, last name, and email.

Parameters:

  • first_name (Optional[str]) – Optional filter to search contacts by first name. If not provided, no filter is applied.

  • last_name (Optional[str]) – Optional filter to search contacts by last name. If not provided, no filter is applied.

  • email (Optional[str]) – Optional filter to search contacts by email. If not provided, no filter is applied.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user for whom to search contacts (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search criteria for the authenticated user.

Return type:

list

Raises:

HTTPException – If no contacts match the search criteria or if an error occurs during the search.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Updates an existing contact for the authenticated user based on the provided contact data and contact ID.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – The updated contact data.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update, must be greater than or equal to 1.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user for whom the contact is being updated (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

Returns:

The updated contact if it exists and belongs to the authenticated user.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID does not exist or does not belong to the authenticated user.

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes USERS¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Updates the avatar URL of the currently authenticated user with an uploaded image file.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file to be uploaded as the user’s new avatar.

  • user (User) – The currently authenticated user, provided by dependency injection.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session used to execute database operations (optional, default is provided by dependency injection).

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If an error occurs during the upload or update process.

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service AUTH¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = <redis.client.Redis(<redis.connection.ConnectionPool(<redis.connection.Connection(host=localhost,port=6379,db=0)>)>)>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates a JSON Web Token (JWT) for access with optional expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The payload data to be included in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Optional expiration time in seconds. If not provided, the token will expire in 15 minutes.

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Creates a JWT token for email verification or other purposes with a 7-day expiration.

This method encodes the provided data into a JWT token with an expiration time set to 7 days from the current UTC time.

Parameters:

data (dict) – A dictionary containing the data to be encoded in the JWT token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT token as a string.

Return type:

str

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates a JSON Web Token (JWT) for refresh with optional expiration time.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The payload data to be included in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Optional expiration time in seconds. If not provided, the token will expire in 7 days.

Returns:

The encoded JWT refresh token.

Return type:

str

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decodes a refresh token to extract the email address if the token is valid.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The JWT refresh token to be decoded.

Returns:

The email address extracted from the token if the token is valid.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an incorrect scope.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves the current user based on the provided JWT token.

This method decodes the JWT token to extract the email address and validates the token’s scope. It then checks the cache for the user. If the user is not found in the cache, it retrieves the user from the database and updates the cache.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT access token used to authenticate the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session for querying user information.

Returns:

The User object corresponding to the email address extracted from the token.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid, has an incorrect scope, or the user is not found.

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Extracts the email address from the provided JWT token.

This method decodes the JWT token to retrieve the email address contained within the token’s payload. If the token is invalid or cannot be decoded, an HTTP 422 exception is raised.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT token from which to extract the email address.

Returns:

The email address extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or cannot be decoded.

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Generates a hashed version of the given password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password to be hashed.

Returns:

The hashed version of the password.

Return type:

str

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verifies if the given plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password to be verified.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

True if the plain password matches the hashed password, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service EMAIL¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email with a verification token to the specified email address.

This method generates a verification token and sends an email to the provided address using the specified username and host. The email includes a verification link to confirm the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – The host URL for generating the verification link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue with sending the email.

Doc-author:

Trelent
